Title: Morphing Identity: Exploring Self-Other Identity Continuum through Interpersonal Facial Morphing Experience
Author: Kye Shimizu, Santa Narus, Jun Nishida, and Shunichi Kasahara
Abstract: We explored continuous changes in self-other identity by designing an interpersonal facial morphing experience where facial images of two users are blended and swapped over time. This study revealed a Self-Other Continuum in the context of agency and facial identity, enhancing our understanding of social and subjective aspects of interpersonal communication.
